media.description:
I broke the glasses* I use in the shop, so I decided to fix them.
Here I'm clamping them and using acrylic cement to try to fuse the frames back together.  I used the drywall screw in the hemostats as an applicator to get the adhesive solution to wick into the gap by capillary action which worked well.  But the adhesive did not hold.


*Costco reading glasses, not prescription, they are a few bucks apiece tops, I'm not sure what compels me to put such energy into these projects.
media.title: 20151101_151951.jpg

media.description:
The resulting joint looked good but did not hold up mechanically.  
The good news is that I have not yet ruined the lenses.
media.title: 20151101_152001.jpg

media.description:
I ended up finding a small screw
drilling a deep small hole
drilling a larger hole to counter sink the screw head
and fastening the glasses together.
media.title: 20151127_141848.jpg

media.description:
Now they LOOK like they belong in the shop.
No one's going to be walking off with these!
media.title: 20151127_141901.jpg
